channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The sign which states parking restrictions has been hit and is leaning., 22nd January
item.description:
Sign is broken has been for a while & is getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 x large potholes, 21st January
item.description:
On the new surface of the A40, heading out of Cheltenham from Arle Court towards the motorway slip road. 2 large potholes have developed on the inside lane. These are quite large in size and if hit when travelling at 60 mph a puncture would be quite possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of large potholes all the way down Buttermilk Lane, Churchdown, Gloucester, 21st January
item.description:
There are a number of potholes from the entrance to Buttermilk Lane all the way down the single track Lane. Some very large holes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Chadbournes, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Flytipping, 21st January
item.description:
Some black bags have been dumped in this fly tipping hot spot lay-by. Please be careful as the last lot was bags of rotten meat! Blurh!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 87 Sussex Gardens, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards in carriageway are too dirty to see when driving, 21st January
item.description:
The row of bollards in the carriageway are so filthy now that they are very hard to see. They are now the same colour as the dirty road surface. I almost hit them when driving in the dark. They are a risk in the daytime too. Please can these be cleaned as soon as possible so that they are more visible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Larches Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement impassable. Undulating surface., 20th January
item.description:
Pavement blocked off, due to undulating surface. School students for both Junior and Senior Schools, as well as other pedestrians, having to walk on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Vicarage Lane, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously broken white line in the middle of the Albion Street was covered with extended solid line, 18th January
item.description:
It looks like a broken white line in the middle of the road, was repainted with extended solid white lane. The solid lane in the middle of Albion Street was extended along junction with CitiPark access and crossroad with Gloucester Place road. Current state is present on attached pictures Pic1 and Pic2, while previous state is present on Pic3. Suspected that while repainting of the road markings the previously broken white line was repainted with solid line, what causes confusion on junction with CitiPark, and crossroad with Gloucester Place road, because of the solid white line extended along. Crossing of the solid white line may cause penalty charge. In this repored case acces to CitiPark and Gloucester Place road causes crossing the solid lane in the middle of the Albion Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 70a Albion Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain cover 40 Bouncers Lane movement, 17th January
item.description:
This road drain cover is loose AGAIN. This means every vehicle which goes over it makes a loud noise. Which means opening windows at night impossible to sleep. Also during the day every vehicle makes a very unpleasant noise to add to the over used road noise and pollution. Continued problem but new issue last 4 months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 73 Bouncer's Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Edge or road surface removed., 17th January
item.description:
The edge of the road surface is damaged and has been broken up and removed. When the road sweeper lorry goes over it, the surface is further eroded and removed. I have witnessed this twice.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 The Lawns, Gotherington
Report on FixMyStreet
